page.title: 19FARM WORKERS LIFE - MONTFORD
page.content: The work of the farm labourer has changed a lot during the lives of many farm workers in this area. They say how much less physical the job has become thanks to the increased use of tractors with lifting gear and other types of mechanisation. Their hours also tend to be less excessive and more regular. They still have to work long days (inc week-ends) at busy harvest or ploughing times and may be called out all night at short notice during calving. Increased use of outside contractors and consultants makes some workers feel a less integral part of the farm. Some also say that the greater use of chemicals and machines - with the associated face masks, helmets and ear protectors - makes it more like a factory job at times, and not the healthy outdoor life it used to be.
